meanings.definition: To surpass in shining or brightness.
meanings.sent1: The sun outshone all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile outshone the glittering lights of the city.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight outshone the glow-in-the-dark stickers on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse outshone the full moon on the dark night.
meanings.sent5: The diamond outshone all the other gems in the jewelry store.

meanings.definition: To surpass in excellence or achievement.
meanings.sent1: His hard work outshone all his classmates' efforts.
meanings.sent2: The champion athlete outshone all others in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The student's science project outshone even the teacher's expectations.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outshone any award she could have received.
meanings.sent5: The team's unity outshone their opponents' skills on the field.
